results.title: Hockey. Film 1. Basic skills
results.creator_credit: University of Queensland and Sally Methven
results.brief_description: Covers some of the basic skills used in hockey: hitting, stopping, pushing and dribbling. It also provides instruction on the bully or start of a game and positions of players on the field. A discussion of both forward and defence players, including the goalkeeper.
results.description: Covers some of the basic skills used in hockey: hitting, stopping, pushing and dribbling. It also provides instruction on the bully or start of a game and positions of players on the field. A discussion of both forward and defence players, including the goalkeeper.

results.title: Hockey one hockey two
results.brief_description: Former Australian International Hockey player Margaret Pierce demonstrates basic skills. In this film Margaret demonstrates the three types of dribbling in Hockey-close, loose and Indian. Aimed at the beginner to intermediate hockey students to improve their skills

results.title: Hockey-the Skills Revolution
results.brief_description: This program demonstrates the latest techniques and skills using the Australian National Team players and their coach, Richard Aggiss. Receiving skills, possession skills, elimination skills, passing skills, goal scoring, penalty strokes, tackles and goal keeping are all demonstrated by world champions Charlesworth, Walsh, Bell, Hazelhurst, Snowden and Berce. Endorsed by the Australian Hockey Association.
results.description: This program demonstrates the latest techniques and skills using the Australian National Team players and their coach, Richard Aggiss. results.title: Hobson's choice
results.creator_credit: British Lion Film Corporation and David Lean
results.brief_description: Based on Harold Brighouse’s 1915 play, this working-class comedy is set in nineteenth century Salford. Henry Hobson (Charles Laughton) is a drunken Lancashire bootmaker who tyrannises his staff and his three daughters. After refusing to allow his daughters to marry because of the expense involved, he is bought to heel by the eldest (Brenda de Banzie) who rebels against her father’s rule to marry his assistant (John Mills). Together with her new husband she sets up a rival boot shop. Lean’s film won the BFI ‘best film’ award in 1954. With Prunella Scales.

results.title: Hobbing a spur gear. Part II. Setting up and hobbing the wor
results.creator_credit: Emerson Yorke Studio and F.E. Brooker
results.brief_description: How to select and mount the hob; how to set the swivel head angel; how to choose and mount the fixture; how to lead the gear blanks; how to set up for depth trial cut; and how to adjust full depth of cut.

results.title: Hobbing a spur gear. Part I. Setting of the change gears
results.creator_credit: Emerson Yorke Studio and F.E. Brooker
results.brief_description: Shows the factors governing the selection of the hob; how to select change-gear combinations for speed, feed, and index; how to identify the correct gears; how to mount the change gears; how to adjust for backlash; and how the change-gear strains are interrelated.

results.title: Hobart: island capital
results.brief_description: The tourist attractions of Hobart, the peaceful capital in the Derwent Valley under the shadow of Mt Wellington. Although many attractive new buildings are rising in the business centre of the city, the old buildings with their historical associations retain the greatest charm. The sea and the docks are only a few minutes from the city and the Royal Hobart Regatta is a highlight of the Tasmanian year.
